intro: Chorizanthe pungens, commonly known as the spiked choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chorizanthe pungens is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in full sun conditions.
